author: Staff Reporter
text:
In a bid to ensure security for ‘protected persons’ following the upcoming assembly polls, necessary equipment was checked by the Department of Police here. Superintendent of Police Ashwin M. Kotnis checked the security equipment and inspected their operating functions here on Monday.

A Technical Inspector was involved in maintaining such security equipment. Moreover, 45 video cameras would also be used by the police to record proceedings of public meetings, processions, campaigns and other poll related activities to check any violation. The personnel deputed on poll duty had been instructed to maintain vigil to ensure free and fair polls, Mr. Kotnis said.
title: Equipment checked
